definition: conclusion/judgment/verdict
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
dialect/language/speech
to tell to
predicate

sentences.chinese: 聽確雙方意見後再下斷語。

sentences.english: I must not decide on my own performance.
sentences.chinese: 我當做不能自己下斷語。

sentences.english: This paper gives a solution to the same kind of questions by applying the popularized conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 藉助一個推廣的斷語，介紹一類問題的通用解法。

sentences.english: I know that he can't deliver without basis thus of break language, be eager to the continuation that to listen to him.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他不會憑空發這樣的斷語，急於要聽他的下文。

sentences.english: Other visionaries say the same about the future of corporations.
sentences.chinese: 其他幻想家也爲未來的公司下了同樣的斷語。

sentences.english: The assertion is known as the closed graph theorem for Hilbert spaces.
sentences.chinese: 這個斷語被稱爲希耳伯特空間的閉圖象定理。

definition: my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)

variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
toil/hard work
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
shameful secret
orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
